reference.shortdesc: The glossSurfaceForm element specifies how the term that is specified by the glossterm element should appear in the text. The surface form is suitable to introduce the term in new contexts or as the first occurrence.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The glossSurfaceForm element is most often used for terms that also specify the glossAcronym element. In that context, the glossSurfaceForm element contains the term in a manner that introduces both the term and the acronym, so that later references to the term can be replaced with the acronym alone.
See the abbreviated-form element for a full description of how the surface form is used together with acronyms.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The glossSurfaceForm element is specialized from p. It is defined in the glossary entry module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following glossary entry topic defines the term "Anti-lock Braking System". Within the topic, the glossSurfaceForm element provides a version of the term that combines both the primary term and the acronym. The content of the glossSurfaceForm might be rendered in introductory contexts when the glossary entry topic is referenced from an abbreviated-form element.
